library-info.title: Asbru protocol for the Management of Hyperbilirubinemia in the Healthy Term Newborn

changes.author: Mar Marcos
changes.description: Changes to treatment intentions (after CBO's proposal)

raw-data-def.user-text: What is the age? (at TSB measurement)
What is the TSB measurement?
What is the birth date?
Is the physical exam OK?
What is the colour of the stools?
What is the colour of the urine?
What is the value of direct serum bilirubin?
What is the value of total urine bilirubin?
Is the gestational age of the child smaller than 37 w?
Has the child lethargy?
Has the child apnea?
Has the child tachypnea?
Has the child instable temperature?
Has the child behavior changes?
Has the child hepatosplenomegaly?
In the child vomitting?
Has the child feeding difficulties?
Has the child excessive weight loss?
What is the blood type of the mother?
What is the rhesus type of the mother?
Has the mother's blood isoimmune antibodies?
What is the blood type of the child?
What is the rhesus type of the child?
What is the result of the direct Coombs test of the child?
Has the child a family history of early jaundice or hemolytic anemia?
Has the child an ethnic origin associated with hemolytic anemia?
Has the child a geographic origin associated with hemolytic anemia?
Is there an early jaundice?
Has the child pallor?
Is the child breastfed?

parameter-group.title: Boolean parameters (they are asked) storing diagnostic information

raw-data-def.user-text: Is there a clinically significant jaundice?
Is there a posibility of hemolytic disease?

plan.name: Exit-possibility-of-G6PD
plan.title: Exit this protocol. Perform appropriate laboratory assessment (possibility of hemolytic disease, probably caused by G6PD).

plan.name: Exit-possibility-of-hemolytic-disease
plan.title: Exit this protocol. Perform appropriate laboratory assessment (possibility of hemolytic disease).

plan.name: Exit-possibility-of-cholestatic-jaundice
plan.title: Perform appropriate laboratory assessment, including possibility of cholestatic jaundice.

plan.name: Exit-provide-routine-care
plan.title: Provide routine care, recommend routine feeding and follow-up.

explanation.text: Follow this infant into routine clinical supervision.
Exiting the protocol to individualized clinical evaluation, including assessment of jaundice in light of prematurity.
Exiting the protocol to individualized clinical evaluation, including assessment of jaundice and non-isoimmune hemolytic disease.
Exiting the protocol to individualized clinical evaluation, including assessment of jaundice and underlying disease.

plan.name: Consider-holding-cord-blood
plan.title: Consider holding infant's cord blood in a blood bank in case future testing is necessary

explanation.text: Exiting the protocol to individualized clinical evaluation, including assessment of jaundice and isoimmune hemolytic disease (positive Coombs test).
Exiting the protocol to individualized clinical evaluation, including assessment of jaundice and non-isoimmune hemolytic disease.

plan.name: Investigate-possibility-of-hemolytic-disease
plan.title: Perform appropriate laboratory assessment of infant including (but not limited to): (1) complete blood count, differential smear, reticulocyte count; (2) G6PD screen; (3) hemoglobin electrophoresis.

plan.name: Blanching-skin-with-digital-pressure-test
plan.title: Blanching skin with digital pressure test

explanation.text: Failure of intensive phototherapy. Perform appropriate laboratory assessment (possibility of hemolytic disease).
